EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Regulation and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations (Regulation 3(d)) amend the Schedule to the Infectious 
Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) to include Covid-19 amongst 
the list of diseases designated as an ‘infectious disease’ for the purposes of the 
Health Act 1947, in accordance with Regulation 6 of those Regulations – all 
diseases that are so designated are required to be notified (by a medical 
practitioner who becomes aware or suspects an instance of such disease) to a 
medical officer of health and are subsequently relayed to the HSE’s Health 
Protection Surveillance Centre in accordance with Regulation 14 of the 1981 
Regulations (as amended). 

These Regulations (Regulation 3(a)) also amend Regulation 8 of the Infectious 
Diseases Regulations 1981 to provide for the inclusion of Covid-19 amongst 
the list of infectious diseases that a person (who is a probable source of 
infection with the disease) may (as a necessary safeguard against the spread of 
the disease) be detained and isolated for, in accordance with the Health Act
